pages.text: When playing co-op with other players, there are $(l)3 team mechanics$() you need to setup to properly work together.$(br2)Click the team types below to jump to the page detailing setup for each one:$(li)$(l:collected_knowledge/coop#islands)Void Islands$()$(li)$(l:collected_knowledge/coop#ftb)FTB Teams (Chunk Loading)$()$(li)$(l:collected_knowledge/coop#together)Advancements/Quests$()

pages.title: Void Islands
pages.text: To create a multiplayer co-op island, perform the following steps:$(numli)1.$() First Player 1 ($(item)P1$()) must run the command $(comm)/island create$(). If an island has already been created, skip to step 2.$(numli)2.$() $(item)P1$() must run the command $(comm)/island invite <username>$() for each other player they wish to team up with, where $(o)<username>$() is the name of the players to be invited.
$(l)3.$() Invited players must run the command $(comm)/island join$() to accept the invitation. Upon accepting, they will be teleported directly to the island.

pages.title: FTB Teams
pages.text: If you wish to $(thing)Chunkload$() your island, you'll need to make use of the FTB Teams system. This is entirely GUI based, and is very simple to setup using the following steps:$(numli)1.$()Select "My Team" button in top left of inventory.$(numli)2.$() $(thing)P1$() selects "Create a New Team", naming it and choosing a colour.$(numli)3.$() At this point, there are two options - $(thing)P1$() can invite other players from the $(l)Members$()

section by clicking on their names, OR, other players can request to join by selecting the team from the list of teams.$(numli)4.$() To confirm the other players' addition to the team, $(thing)P1$() must approve join requests, or other players must accept invites, depending on which method was used at step 3.$(br2)Images over page.

pages.title: Advancements/Quests
pages.text: In order to sync your advancements, and by extension your progress through this book, your team will need to perform the following:$(numli)1.$()$(thing)P1$() must use the command $(comm)/tofe invite <username>$() to invite each other player to the team.$(numli)2. $()Other players must use the command $(comm)/tofe accept <p1's username>$() to accept the invitation.$(br)In the event progress is not synced, you can use $(comm)/tofe forcesync$()
